DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Platelet Count Eligibility Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded yes/no/not applicable indicator whether a medical procedure has been performed that involves testing a sample of blood for the platelet count, the real number of irregularly shaped disk like cytoplasmic fragment of a megakaryocyte that is shed in the marrow sinus and subsequently found in the peripheral blood where it functions in clotting, as a method of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Platelet Count Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for the platelet count, the real number of irregularly shaped disklike cytoplasmic fragment of a megakaryocyte that is shed in the marrow sinus and subsequently found in the peripheral blood where it functions in clotting, as a method of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: The determination of the number of platelets in a blood sample, usually expressed as platelets per cubic millimeter (cmm) of whole blood.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: The determination of the number of platelets in a biospecimen.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is pre-study platelet count g
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 140,000/mcl?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 100 x 10^9/L?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 75 X 10^9/L?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 75,000/mcL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 150,000/mcl?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 50,000/mcL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than 50,000/mcL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 50,000/mcL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 75,000/mcL unless due to marrow involvement by lymphoma in which case a platelet count of greater than or equal to 30,000/mcL will be used?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than 100,000/mcl?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 50,000/mcl, or recovery to baseline count?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 75,000/mcL (greater than or equal to 50,000/mcL for patients with hematologic malignancies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 100,000/mcl, independent of transfusion for at least 7 days prior to screening and independent of growth factor support for at least 14 days prior to screening?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 75,000/mcL, within 2 weeks of randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 50,000 cells/mm3 if marrow plasmacytosis is less than 50% OR platelet count is greater than or equal to 30,000 cells/mm3 if marrow plasmacytosis is greater than or equal to 50%?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 100,000/mm3?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 100,000/mcl within 28 days prior to administration of therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Therdaex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 75,000/mcL, within 7 days before starting treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 75,000/mcL or if thrombocytopenia is related to bone marrow involvement with lymphoma, is platelet count greater than or equal to 50,000/mcL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theraadex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is screening visit platelet count greater than or equal to 100,000/mcL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 50,000 cells/mm3 (or greater than or equal to 30,000 cells/mm2 if bone marrow plasma cells greater than or equal to 50% at enrollment)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 75,000/mcL, unless there is documented bone marrow involvement by lymphoma?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 23
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 100,000/mcl for solid tumor patients or greater than or equal to 75,000/mcL for lymphoma patients?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 100,000/uL (with no transfusion in the past 10 days)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 27
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 100,000/mcl, within 8 days of enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 24
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than the lower limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 28
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 100,000/mcL (solid tumor patients) or greater than or equal to 75,000 mcL (lymphoma patients)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 26
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 100 x 10^9/L (unless decreased due to bone marrow involvement with lymphoma)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 30
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to institutional LLN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 25
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 100,000/mcl (within 7 days of study drug initiation)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 29
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 25,000/mcL, unless patient has an active hematologic malignancy and/or bone marrow involvement by any cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 34
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 100,000/mcl independent of transfusion, within 14 days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 31
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 75,000/mm3?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 32
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 75,000/mm3 (75x10e9/L), transfusion independent, defined as not receiving platelet transfusions at least 7 days prior to initiation of protocol therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 33
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is platelet count greater than or equal to 100,000/mcL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 35
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than 75,000/mcl?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 39
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelets greater than or equal to 100,000/mcL, within 14 days prior to treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 38
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 100,000/mcL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 37
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 75,000/mcL, with no platelet transfusions to help patients meet eligibility criteria within 2 weeks before study enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 40
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 125 x 10^9/L?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 36
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 100,000/mcL, independent of transfusions?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 41
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 125,000/mcL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 42
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 100 K/cumm within 14 days of enrollment and no transfusions with red blood cells or platelets within 1 week prior to screening assessment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 44
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 1 × 10^11/L?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 43
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 75,000/mcL unless documented bone marrow involvement in which case lower values may be allowed?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 45
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 150,000/mcL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 46
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count within 2 weeks of enrollment greater than or equal to 100,000/mcL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 47
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than 75,000/mcl or is platelet count greater than or equal to 50 x 10e9/L if there is documented lymphomatous involvement of the bone marrow as assessed by bone marrow biopsy within 90 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 48
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 100,000/mcl within 14 days prior to study registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 49
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 1.5 x 10^9L?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 50
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 100,000/mcL (greater than 50,000 if BM clonal plasma cell involvement is greater than 50%)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 51
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 100,000/mcL?
